# Blurmage

<center>![](blurmage.gif)</center>

Generate lazy-loading HTML images with a blurred inline preview.

### Install

```bash
npm -g i blurmage
```

### How to use

Pass an URL or path of an image file as first argument of the cli tool `blurmage`, the resulting tag will be printed on the console.

**Example**

```bash
‚ùØ blurmage http://caffeina.com/media/New-Office.jpg
```

The outputted tag will be :

```
<!--IMG--><div class="-blurmage" style="transform:translatez(0);background-image:url(data:image/jpeg;base64,);background-size:cover;background-position:center center;transition:background-image .45s ease-in-out;width:1023px;height:670px;"><img width="1023" height="670" src="http://caffeina.com/media/New-Office.jpg" style="visibility:hidden" onload="this.parentNode.style['background-image']='url('+this.src+')'"></div><!--/IMG-->
```


### Example

<div class="-blurmage" style="margin:0 auto;transform:translatez(0);background-image:url(data:image/jpeg;base64,);background-size:cover;background-position:center center;transition:background-image .45s ease-in-out;width:500px;height:327px;"><img width="500" height="327" src="http://caffeina.com/media/New-Office.jpg" style="visibility:hidden" onload="this.parentNode.style['background-image']='url('+this.src+')'"></div>
